availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Sherman E. Tuttle (Wayne County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Wayne County, Kentucky, farmer. Connecticut native. Son of William and Hannah Tuttle. Married to Telitha Cowan in Wayne County on October 21, 1844. Father of Mary C. Tuttle, James H. Tuttle, Charles E. Tuttle, George A. Tuttle, Hannah H. Tuttle, and Rufus Tuttle. Married to Louisa E. Mercer in Wayne County on April 5, 1864. Father of Harriet Tuttle. Carpenter in Wayne County in 1850. Farmer in Wayne County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in 1860.
